definition: to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
to disseminate/to give publicity to/propaganda/CL:個|个[ge4]
to transmit/to pass on to sb else/(math.) transitive
legendary/fantasy saga/romance/short stories of the Tang and Song Dynasty
(of a sound) to come through/to be heard/(of news) to arrive
legend/folklore/to repeat from mouth to mouth/they say that...

sentences.english: Mongolian national minority's traditional virtue are many, the father teaches me for the generation toward downloading.
sentences.chinese: 蒙古族的傳統美德多呀，阿爸教我代代往下傳呀。

sentences.english: AT seven-thirty Friday evening Scali passed this word along.
sentences.chinese: 星期五晚上七時半，斯卡利把話傳了過去。

sentences.english: You may also forward us a list of qualified drivers from your respective countries for our reference.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以自貴國傳一份合格選手的名單給我們參考。

sentences.english: They both passed on their bacons at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 他們倆都同時把接力棒傳了過去。

sentences.english: Love is natural instincts but also needs the janitor who studies ability .
sentences.chinese: 愛是天性但也需要學習才能傳逹。

sentences.english: The story was told from one generation to another.
The most typical is the so-called "nursery rhyme", that children can recite the proliferation of those who pass.
sentences.chinese: 最典型的是所謂“童謠”，即兒童也能誦傳擴散者。

sentences.english: From the room came a sound of quarrelling.
sentences.chinese: 爭吵聲從那個房間裏傳了出來。

sentences.english: God has ordained that people be reconciled to him through the preachingof the gospel by Christians.
sentences.chinese: 神命定人們通過基督徒向他們傳福音與他和好。

sentences.english: A palace maid was killed for gossiping about the East Palace story.
sentences.chinese: 一個宮女就因私傳東宮的事被殺了。

sentences.english: Hear that? It’s the sound of wedding bells ringing on Bones.
sentences.chinese: 《識骨尋蹤》又將在第五季再傳婚禮鐘聲。

sentences.english: Gotan urgent message you need to transmit immediately?
sentences.chinese: 你需要立即傳一份十分緊急的信息？

sentences.english: 18And with many other words John exhorted the people and preached the good news to them.
sentences.chinese: 約翰又用許多別的話勸百姓，向他們傳福音。

sentences.english: Chapter 4 mainly explored literal values of the biographies.
sentences.chinese: 第四章主要是隱逸傳的文學價值的探討。

sentences.english: We go out to witness and preach the Gospel of Christ through the spreading of the Word of God.
sentences.chinese: 我們出去透過傳逹神的話語，見證及宣講基督的福音。

definition: to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to transmit/to pass on to sb else/(math.) transitive
to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
